List.Name: Number of images managed
List.Tooltip: Select "0x02,firmware and data images" if the firmware manages a data area located in HDPL2 OBkeys to store its secrets (keys, ...), else select "0x01,firmware image only"

Bool.Name: High speed clock activation (250Mhz)
Bool.Tooltip: Activate the high speed clock (250Mhz) during StiRoT execution

Bool.Name: Is the firmware full secure
Bool.Tooltip: Tick the box if the firmware is full secure

Data.Name: Firmware execution area offset
Data.Tooltip: Enter the offset of the firmware execution area from the beginning of the user flash (aligned on sector start address)

Data.Name: Firmware download area offset
Data.Tooltip: Enter the offset of the firmware download area from the beginning of the user flash (aligned on sector start address)

Data.Name: Firmware area size
Data.Tooltip: Enter the size of the firmware for both download and execution areas (aligned on sector size)

Data.Name: Data area offset in HDPL2 OBkeys
Data.Tooltip: Enter the offset of the data area from the beginning of the OBkeys start address

Data.Name: Data slot size in HDPL2 OBKeys
Data.Tooltip: Enter the size of the data area in HDPL2 OBkeys (maximum is 0x2F0 : no overlap with HDPL3 OBKeys allowed)

Data.Name: Data download area offset
Data.Tooltip: Enter the offset of the data download area from the beginning of the user flash (aligned on sector start address)

Data.Name: Data download slot size
Data.Tooltip: Enter the size of the download data area (aligned on sector size)

Data.Name: Size of the secure area inside the firmware execution area
Data.Tooltip: Enter the size of the secure area inside the firmware execution slot (aligned on sector size). If the firmware is full secure, this size should be equal to the firmware area size But the firmware can be made of a secure part and a non secure part but at least the first sector is secure.

Bool.Name: SRAM2 erasing in case of reset
Bool.Tooltip: If selected, the SRAM2 will be erased in case of reset

Bool.Name: SRAM2 ECC management activation
Bool.Tooltip: If selected, ECC (Error Code Correction) will be managed. ECC is a mechanism to prevent mechanisms prevent external attacks.

List.Name: Product state minimal allowed
List.Tooltip: After checking its authenticity and integrity STiRoT will execute the firmware only if the product state programmed in option byte is at equal or greater than the "Product state minimal allowed"

File.Name: Encryption key
File.Tooltip: Select the key used to encrypt firmware and data images. When this key is regenerated, both frmware and data images must be processed with Imgtool

File.Name: Authentication key
File.Tooltip: Select the key used to authenticate firmware and data images. When this key is regenerated, both frmware and data images must be processed with Imgtool

Output.Name: Output File
Output.Tooltip: Select the output file .obk including STiRoT configuration
